paper_abstract: We derive an asymptotic formula for the number of strongly connected digraphs with n vertices and m arcs (directed edges), valid for m - n as n provided m = O(nlog n). This fills the gap between Wright's results which apply to m = n + O (1), and the long-known threshold for m, above which a random digraph with n vertices and m arcs is likely to be strongly connected. (c) 2012 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 2013
paper_title: Asymptotic enumeration of strongly connected digraphs by vertices and edges
